column4: We went to a special Cinerama cinema with three screens.
column5: We enjoyed the film and talked about it after it was over.
column6: My brother thought the movie was boring.
column7: My brother and I enjoyed it so much that we planned our next trip.

column2: Today was moving day.
column3: Unfortunately, it started to rain early in the morning.
column4: Since I had all my stuff packed, the move was quick.
column5: We got a little wet!
column6: I wish it would rain more.
column7: I wish it was sunny.

column2: We decided to take a trip today.
column3: The sky was overcast and it was cold.
column4: We got going and it started to rain.
column5: We had to stop because it was raining so hard.
column6: After an hour the rain cleared and we were on our way again.
column7: When we set off again, the roads were completely dry.

column2: I had two dogs that were very close.
column3: The older dog became very ill and was put to sleep.
column4: The younger dog was very lonely.
column5: Our neighbor's dog comes over to play.
column6: Our dog really enjoys having the house to himself.
column7: Our dog feels much better when he plays with another dog.

column2: Our family moved from New York to North Carolina.
column3: We really missed our family and friends back home.
column4: One weekend our aunt and cousin came to visit.
column5: We spent four days together and did a lot of fun things.
column6: I was glad when they finally left.
column7: I was sad when they went home.

column2: We were in the park with friends.
column3: We had a basketball, but we were looking for a court.
column4: We found a playground at the end of the park.
column5: We pulled out the balls and played for an hour.
column6: My friends and I had a lot of fun and then we went home.
column7: We couldn't find a good basketball court.

column2: My kids had lice a while ago.
column3: All four of them got it.
column4: We had to clean the whole house.
column5: We treated their hair twice to make sure it was gone.
column6: I punished my children with long house arrest.
column7: The source of the lice has never been identified.

column2: In 2006 we went on a family vacation to Portland, Maine.
column3: We visited the art museum.
column4: We visited the waterfront and had dinner on the boat.
column5: We were watching a minor league baseball game.
column6: We have decided to repeat this holiday in the future.
column7: Our vacation was a failure because there was nothing to do.

column2: A friend and I were on vacation at the beach.
column3: We went to a beach that was inhabited by wild dogs.
column4: One dog, named Rubia, watched our stuff while we swam.
column5: We were so happy that we brought her meat the next day.
column6: Rubia was very nice to us afterwards.
column7: Rubia was a very bad dog.

column2: Kayla tried out for American Idol.
column3: The jurors told her she wasn't quite what they were looking for.
column4: Kayla was really sad, but she lived on.
column5: A few weeks later, she got a call from American Idol.
column6: A new position opened up and Kayla was able to participate in the show.
column7: Kayla became obsessed with giraffes and got a job at the zoo.

column2: Tom was making pasta.
column3: He boiled water.
column4: He left the kitchen to make an important phone call.
column5: When he came back, there was water all over the ground.
column6: He forgot to turn on the stove.
column7: He turned off the stove and cleaned the kitchen.

column2: Billy really needed help with the test.
column3: He was worried all night that he wasn't going to pass.
column4: He went to school early and his friend Ash helped him.
column5: When he got the test, he knew all the answers.
column6: Billy failed the test.
column7: Billy passed the test.

column2: Jane bought a backpack online for her teenage nephew.
column3: She was pleased with how excited he was when she handed it to him.
column4: He hastily ripped the plastic wrapping off his backpack.
column5: When he tried them on, they were too small.
column6: Jane was relieved.
column7: Jane was disappointed.

column2: Miles knew his girlfriend Teresa loved pandas.
column3: He came up with a plan to give her the perfect birthday present.
column4: He spent the whole week making stuffed pandas for her.
column5: When it was her birthday, he gave it to her.
column6: Teresa was so grateful that she kissed Miles on the spot.
column7: Teresa decided to sell the pandas Miles gave her.

column2: Devin always liked to play video games with his best friend.
column3: They played video games together for more than ten years.
column4: Yet every time they got together to play, they felt like it was the first time.
column5: When his best friend brought a new game, it was the same.
column6: Devin was thrilled with his friend's choice.
column7: Devin and his friend ignored the game and watched TV.

column2: I was supposed to turn in my online project today.
column3: This was a group task with three other members.
column4: My duty was to organize an informative PowerPoint.
column5: When I called them to email me their work, no one answered.
column6: I was frustrated and scared by their lack of response.
column7: I decided it was their problem and not to worry about it.

column2: I was really looking forward to the Jimmy Buffett concert.
column3: My friend Jeff was supposed to pick me up at 6:00 p.m.
column4: But I wanted to sleep, so I took a little nap around four o'clock.
column5: When I finally woke up, it was almost 8 o'clock in the evening!
column6: I was so disappointed that I missed the concert.
column7: I was glad to get some sleep.

column2: I was walking home on my way on the school bus.
column3: When I got to the entrance, I tried to open the door.
column4: The door was locked.
column5: When I tried to look for the keys, I couldn't find them anywhere.
column6: Then I found my spare key and went inside.
column7: I was locked out and had to move to a new house.

column2: My roommate made fish for dinner last night.
column3: The fish was unfortunately very bad.
column4: Still, I ate it because he tried so hard.
column5: When I finished, he told me he didn't like the food.
column6: I suggested that he apply for the cook's job where I worked.
column7: I told him I felt the same way.

column2: Greg was a messy person.
column3: And he ate every meal at his computer desk.
column4: One day he poured lemonade on his keyboard.
column5: On his birthday, a friend bought him a new keyboard.
column6: Greg was disappointed with his gift.
column7: Greg has decided not to eat at his computer desk anymore.

column2: On the Fourth of July, the bank held an ice cream party.
column3: Mommy took her toddler to see it.
column4: They were standing in line.
column5: When it was their turn, they got a balloon and ice cream.
column6: The father and son then went home.
column7: The toddler was very happy with the treats.

column2: Nancy just got back from work.
column3: After the phone vibrated, she picked it up.
column4: She got a message from her boyfriend asking her to break up.
column5: When she called him, he didn't answer the phone.
column6: She sent him a text asking if he wanted to go to the movies.
column7: She left him a very angry voicemail.

column2: Liz babysat her four and six-year-old nieces.
column3: She put them in her room to take a nap.
column4: They were very quiet, so she thought they were asleep.
column5: When she checked on them an hour later, they weren't asleep.
column6: Liz was glad they were sleeping so well.
column7: Liz told them to go back to bed.

column2: Mary's family was gathering for a holiday dinner at the club.
column3: Everyone was supposed to be there except Mary's grandfather.
column4: Marie was sad that the whole family would not be together.
column5: When she arrived at the club, she was surprised to see her grandfather!
column6: Mary was so upset!
column7: Mary was so happy!

column2: Nancy was trying to print out her class assignment.
column3: The printer caught an error and froze.
column4: The reboot took a few minutes.
column5: When she got the papers, they were blank.
column6: Nancy felt frustrated.
column7: Nancy was relieved.

column2: Amy wanted to make waffles for breakfast.
column3: She whipped the dough quickly.
column4: She poured the dough into the baking machine.
column5: When she ate them, there were lumps of dry dough on them.
column6: Amy was disappointed.
column7: Amy thought they tasted great.

column2: Sarah was very hungry.
column3: She went to the kitchen to eat, but she only had bread.
column4: She made toast with butter and jam.
column5: When she went to the table, she dropped the toast.
column6: Sarah was so depressed.
column7: Sarah was glad she had dropped the toast.

column2: Mary went to the market on Sunday to get fruit.
column3: She bought bananas but couldn't find peaches.
column4: She decided to wait until next time to pick peaches.
column5: When she went there again, there were still no peaches.
column6: Mary was disappointed.
column7: Mary didn't want peaches.

column2: Mark's parents had an announcement.
column3: They were going to have a baby.
column4: Mark got angry and went to his room.
column5: As the child approached, Mark walked over to him.
column6: Mark wanted to meet the baby.
column7: Mark didn't look at the child.

column2: Kathie doesn't like children.
column3: One day she got pregnant.
column4: She was afraid she might not like the baby.
column5: When the baby was born, she fell in love with him.
column6: Kathie gave the baby up for adoption.
column7: Kathie decided she didn't mind having another one.

column2: On the Fourth of July, Lilly baked a lemon blueberry pie.
column3: She brought it to her friend's house and they had a barbecue.
column4: After dinner they went into town to watch the fireworks.
column5: When the show was over, they got donuts from the refreshment truck.
column6: Lilly had a terrible date.
column7: Lilly had a great time.

column2: The Brown family was going to the Grand Canyon.
column3: They all got in the car and started the drive from Iowa.
column4: There were many stops along the way and the journey was long.
column5: When they got to the canyon, the kids jumped out of the car.
column6: Disgusted and angry, they returned home.
column7: They all took photos, which they posted on their Facebook pages.

column2: Maggie has a dog.
column3: He walks his dog.
column4: He goes to the park to play.
column5: When they get home, Maggie feeds her dog.
column6: Maggie and her dog are best friends.
column7: Maggie doesn't like spending time with her smelly dog.

column2: Katie decided it would be fun to dye Easter eggs.
column3: She got her siblings together and they started dying by the dozen.
column4: They chose all different colours.
column5: When they were finished, they looked beautiful.
column6: They were proud of their eggs.
column7: They were sad about the eggs.

column2: When I was eighteen, I registered to vote.
column3: I was excited to be part of the democratic process.
column4: I did my research on each candidate.
column5: When election day came, I went to the polling station.
column6: I was sad when my candidate lost the election.
column7: I started singing and dancing as I had rehearsed.

column2: One Christmas I got a shiny, expensive-looking briefcase.
column3: The next day I filled my new suitcase and gathered my things.
column4: While I was loading the car, I put the case temporarily on the roof.
column5: When I was driving, people beeped at me.
column6: People were trying to greet me.
column7: I didn't realize where my briefcase was.

column2: Ethan was moving into an apartment downtown.
column3: He really didn't consider the changes he would have to make if he left the house.
column4: So when he built a drum kit, it was really hard.
column5: He had five noise complaints within 10 minutes.
column6: Soon he had to find a house to move into.
column7: He was happy that people liked his drumming.

column2: Nicole wanted to be an aunt more than anything.
column3: The trouble was that she had no siblings.
column4: Today, Nicole got a message from her cousin Xiao.
column5: Xiao and her husband were expecting a baby boy.
column6: She thought she could be an honorary aunt.
column7: She decided she didn't like children.

column2: Steve felt angry, so he went to the grocery store.
column3: He bought sugar, eggs and flour.
column4: He came home and preheated the oven to three hundred and fifty degrees.
column5: When it was time, he put the baking sheet in.
column6: Steve didn't have much of a sweet tooth.
column7: Steve knew the cookies would cheer him up.

column2: It was time for Manjul to move to a new place.
column3: She needed her office in the square to be easily walkable.
column4: She also didn't have much money to invest in repairs.
column5: Manjul also wanted a cozy place.
column6: She found a really beautiful old farmhouse on a nice piece of land.
column7: She found a great studio apartment downtown.

column2: Hilda was known as a pretty girl.
column3: People said her eyes looked like the clear sky.
column4: She wanted to get dressed and paint her nails before going out.
column5: She went to her mom's to pick up a set of nail polish.
column6: She found a beautiful blue one.
column7: She enthusiastically chose red.

column2: We have been told that Mars will be visible the following morning.
column3: I set my alarm for early morning.
column4: I got my binoculars and flashlight ready.
column5: In the morning, I bundled up and ran out.
column6: It was hard to see her, but after a while her splendor became apparent.
column7: It was so easy to spot in the beautiful daylight!

column2: Keith took a long hike up the Grand Canyon.
column3: He was late, so he didn't want to stop.
column4: Because Keith felt tired, he drank a lot of coffee and water.
column5: He began to feel uncomfortable about it, but refused to stop.
column6: When he reached the place, he decided to rest and enjoy the beauty of the canyon.
column7: When he got there, he immediately ran to the bathroom.
